BooseApp
Table of Contents

Namespace BradleyLeach_BooseApp

Classes

AppArray

Represents an array variable (int or real) in the program, supporting both declaration and array operations. Provides logic for array creation, parameter validation, and value access/modification.

AppBoolean

Represents a boolean variable or expression within the program. Provides logic for compiling and evaluating boolean values.

AppBooseFacade

Facade class for storing all BOOSE app funcionality together, keeps GUI form clean from any BOOSE dependent code.

AppCanvas

This class is responsible for drawing on the canvas.

AppCircle

Command class to draw circle centered at the current position with specified radius.

AppCommandFactory

Factory class to create BOOSE application specific commands.

AppCompoundCommand

Represents a compound control flow command (such as if, while, for, or switch) that can contain nested commands. Inherits from AppConditionalCommand and provides linking to the corresponding control command.

AppConditionalCommand

Base class for conditional control flow commands such as if, while, and for. Provides common properties and logic for managing block structure and condition evaluation.

AppDrawTo

Command class to draw a line from the current position to a specified position.

AppElse

Command class representing an 'else' block in the program. Handles control flow for the 'else' part of an if-else conditional structure.

AppEnd

Command class representing the end of a control flow block (if, while, for) in the program. Handles linking to the corresponding start command and manages control flow for loops.

AppFill

Command class for the shape fill toggle command.

AppFor

Command class representing a 'for' loop block in the program. Evaluates start, end, and step expressions, manages the loop variable, and controls program flow for iteration.

AppICanvasAdapter

Adapter class responsible for porting core BOOSE command class' / interfaces to the new app version. Allows for additional canvas functionality with the IAppCanvas interface.

AppIf

Command class representing an 'if' conditional block in the program. Evaluates a boolean condition and controls program flow based on the result.

AppInt

Command class responsible for dealing with Integer type varaibles.

AppMoveTo

Command class to move the current drawing position to a specified position.

AppNoCommand

Blank BOOSE command that does nothing. Used for maintaining correct line numbering in case of commands with invlaid syntax.

AppParser

Parser class to interpret BOOSE commands for the application.

AppPeek

Command class for reading a value from an array at a specified index (peek operation) and assigning it to a variable. Inherits from AppArray and implements the peek logic for both int and real arrays.

AppPenColour

Command class to change the current pen colour to specified RGB values.

AppPoke

Command class for writing a value into an array at a specified index (poke operation). Inherits from AppArray and implements the poke logic for both int and real arrays.

AppReal

Command class responsible for dealing with Floating point (Real) varaibles.

AppRect

Command class to draw a rectangle of specified width and height from the current position.

AppStoredProgram

Stored program responsible for storing commands and executing them, extends base StoredProgram class.

AppWhile

Command class representing a 'while' loop block in the program. Evaluates a boolean condition and controls program flow to repeat the block while the condition is true.

AppWrite

Command class for writing text or evaluated expressions to the canvas.

Form1

Represents the main form of the application, providing the user interface for rendering a canvas, parsing and executing commands, and displaying runtime results or errors.

Interfaces

IAppCanvas

Overridden BOOSE.ICanvas interface to allow for custom methods for additional commands to AppCanvas.

Enums

AppConditionalCommand.conditionalTypes

Enumeration of supported conditional command types.

Made with docfx
